item.title: About Me
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces"][vc_column][pikoworks_light_box image="5123" css=".vc_custom_1502205120748{border-top-width: 1px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;border-top-color: #e7e7e7 !important;border-top-style: solid !important;}"][vc_custom_heading title_font_size="fs60" text="WAYNE EVANS" use_theme_fonts="yes" sub_title="Co-Founder – President & COO"][vc_column_text]Wayne co-founded Massage Heights in 2004 with her husband Shane. Today she is responsible for the company’s services, products and programs, and also helps develop strategic initiatives. Shane feels whole when balancing a busy career with family life, supporting her children and husband in their passions: exercise, art, dance, horseback riding and sports.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading title_font_size="fs30" text="Wayneevans" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:right" google_fonts="font_family:Montez%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" css=".vc_custom_1502132924950{margin-top: -20px !important;padding-right: 30px !important;}"][/pikoworks_light_box][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces"][vc_column][pikoworks_light_box type_pos="right" image="5127"][vc_custom_heading title_font_size="fs60" text="HANDCRAFT" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]Take the latest collection from Wes Gordon: His fall presentation was distinctly cool and sleek – that’s his signature direction – but the use of delicate floral appliqués and guipure lace gave an opulent, almost old-world feeling to his ultramodern pieces. As Gordon puts it, “The idea is to take these materials and do them in a way that works in[/vc_column_text][/pikoworks_light_box][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces"][vc_column][pikoworks_light_box type="video" bg_video="https://youtu.be/U31VGOCyJpM" bg_height="950" image="5129"][vc_custom_heading title_font_size="fs60" text=" TRADITIONAL TECHNIQUES" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]While innovations in fabric technology have been pushing fashion forward for several seasons now, this fall, designers took cues from traditional craft techniques like beading, embroidery and lace-work to lend their collections a sense of luxury. Odessa Paloma Parker explains how this shift from present to past is giving investment dressing a whole new dimension[/vc_column_text][/pikoworks_light_box][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces"][vc_column][pikoworks_light_box type_pos="right" image="5130"][vc_custom_heading title_font_size="fs60" text="OUR SKILLS"
